Package org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv

EPICS JavaIOC: support
package: org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv
2009.02.25

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
PDRVSupport Extension of LinkSupport for PDRV (portDriver).
 

Class Summary
AbstractPDRVSupport Abstract link support base class for PDRV links.
PDRVPortCreateFactory Record Support for starting a port driver.
PDRVPortDeviceControlFactory Record Support for starting a port driver.
PDRVSupportFactory Factory to create portDriver link support.
 

Package org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv Description

EPICS JavaIOC: support
package: org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv

Overview

This package implements support for connecting database fields to portDriver.

The following interfaces are available:

PDRVSupport
An extension for links to portDriver.

The following abstract classes are provided for implementing support:

AbstractPDRVSupport
A base class for portDriver support.

The following factories are provided:

PDRVSupportFactory
Creates support for each of the portDriver interfaces.
PDRVPortCreateFactory
Creates a portDriver port.
PDRVPortDeviceControlFactory
Creates support for a portDeviceControl record, which provides the ability change the connect, enable, traceMask, and traceIOMask states of a port or a device connected to a port. It also can get a report for a port and/or device.

portDriver Support

Java Definitions

The following are the interface, abstract support, and factories for portDriver support.

    public interface PDRVSupport extends Support {
        boolean isProcess();
        abstract void queueCallback();
    }

    public class PDRVSupportFactory {
        public static Support create(PVStructure pvStructure);
    }
    
    public abstract class AbstractPDRVSupportSupport extends AbstractSupport implements
    ProcessContinueRequester,QueueRequestCallback,
    PDRVSuppor,
    RecordProcessRequester
    {
        protected AbstractPDRVSupportSupport(String supportName,PVStructure pvStructure);
        protected String supportName;
        protected PVStructure pvStructure;
        protected PVField valuePVField = null;
        protected PVRecord pvRecord = null;
        protected String recordName = null;
        protected String fullName = null;
        protected RecordProcess recordProcess = null;
    
        protected AlarmSupport alarmSupport = null;
        protected PVStructure configStructure = null;;
        protected PVString pvPortName = null;
        protected PVString pvDeviceName = null;
        protected PVInt pvMask = null;
        protected PVInt pvSize = null;
        protected PVDouble pvTimeout = null;
        protected PVBoolean pvProcess = null;
        protected PVString pvDrvParams = null;
    
        protected User user = null;
        protected Port port = null;
        protected Device device = null;
        protected Trace portTrace = null;
        protected Trace deviceTrace = null;
    
        protected DriverUser driverUser = null;
    
        protected SupportProcessRequester supportProcessRequester = null;
        public void initialize(RecordSupport recordSupport);
        public void uninitialize();
        public void start();
        public void stop();
        public void process(SupportProcessRequester supportProcessRequester);
        public void message(String message,MessageType messageType);
        public void processContinue();
        public void callback(Status status, User user);
        public boolean isProcess();
        public void queueCallback();
        public void recordProcessComplete();
        public void recordProcessResult(RequestResult requestResult)
    }

    public class PDRVPortCreateFactory {
        public static Support create(PVStructure pvStructure);
    }

    public class PDRVPortDeviceControlFactory {
        public static Support create(PVStructure pvStructure)
    }

PDRVSupport

This defines the two methods:

isProcess
If the support is interrupt driver should it process the record. The answer will be true only if:
  1. The constructor for AbstractPDRVSupportSupport is called with interruptOK true
  2. pdrvSupport.interrupt is true.
  3. The support is the record processor.
queueCallback
A method that must be implemented by all asynchronous support. his probably means all support except interrupt listeners.

AbstractPDRVSupport

This implements muck of the work involved in connecting and managing the connection to a port and device. Look at some of the code in PDRVSupportFactory for how to use the abstract support.

PDRVSupportFactory

This implements all of the link support defined in .xml file javaIOC/xml/structures/portDriver.xml.

<structure name = "pdrvSupport">
  <scalar name = "portName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "deviceName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "timeout" type = "double" />
  <scalar name = "mask" type = "int" />
  <scalar name = "size" type = "int" />
  <scalar name = "process" type = "boolean" default = "false" />
</structure>

<structure name = "pdrvOctetInputFactory">
  <scalar name = "supportFactory" type = "string">
     org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv.PDRVSupportFactory</scalar>
</structure>

PDRVPortCreateFactory

This implements support for the portCreate structure which has the definition:

<structure name = "portCreateFactory">
  <scalar name = "supportFactory" type = "string">
     org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv.PDRVPortCreateFactory</scalar>
</structure>

<structure name = "portCreate">
  <auxInfo name = "supportFactory" type = "string">portCreateFactory</auxInfo>
  <scalar name = "factoryName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "portName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "autoConnect" type = "boolean">true</scalar>
  <structure name = "priority" type = "scanPriority" />
</structure>

This is support for a record or structure that initializes a portDriver port.

PDRVPortDeviceControlFactory

This implements support for the portDeviceControl which has the definition:

<structure name = "portDeviceControlFactory">
  <scalar name = "supportFactory" type = "string">
     org.epics.ioc.support.pdrv.PDRVPortDeviceControlFactory</scalar>
</structure>

<structure name = "portDeviceControl">
  <auxInfo name = "supportFactory" type = "string">portDeviceControlFactory</auxInfo>
  <scalar name = "message" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "portName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "deviceName" type = "string" />
  <scalar name = "connect" type = "boolean"  />
  <scalar name = "enable" type = "boolean"   />
  <scalar name = "autoConnect" type = "boolean" />
  <scalar name = "traceMask" type = "int"  />
  <scalar name = "traceIOMask" type = "int" />
  <scalar name = "traceIOTruncateSize" type = "int" />
  <scalar name = "report" type = "boolean" />
  <scalar name = "reportDetails" type = "int" />
</structure>
